owl:Ontology.dc:creator: María Poveda Villalón
Raúl García Castro
Serge Chávez Feria
owl:Ontology.dc:description: The Occupancy Profile ontology has been developed to represent and define occupancy profiles in building spaces.|
owl:Ontology.dc:title: Occupancy Profile ontology

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship that indicates the composition of a set of drivers.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: composed of

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property used to describe occupant needs by defining comfort limits w.r.t. an environmental parameter.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: defined by range

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property to relate an interaction with a formula describing the probability of occurance.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: described by formula

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates a comfort envelop with an environmental parameter.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: describes parameter

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates a spatial driver to an specific building space
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: detailed by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property to link an occupant with a set of internal or external drivers that are controlling its interactions with building systems.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: driven by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property to indicate that an occupant has a behavior.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has behavior

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates a formula with a coefficient.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has coefficient

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates which days of the week are behavioral drivers for an occupant.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has day of week

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates and occupant environmental driver with an environmental property like temperature or illuminance.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has environmental parameter

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates a formula with an independent variable.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has independent variable

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates that a meeting can occur within a space.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has meeting

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship that indicates that an space can have an occupant.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has occupant

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship to indicate the type of control mode of a system, such as fixed or operable modes for a window.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has operational mode

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates which seasons are behavioral drivers for an occupant.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has season

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates which times during a day are behavioral drivers for an occupant.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has time of day

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship that indicates the type of status transition event.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has transition type

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates an environmental parameter with a unit of measure.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has unit of measure

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates that a driver can be influenced by an occupant comfort need.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: influenced by need

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship that describes an interaction between an occupant and a building component or system.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: interacts over

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship to indicate the outcome of a behavior. It could lead to an action over a building system to recover comfort or to a passive acceptance of the environmental conditions.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: leads to

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that relates space occupancy events to an specific building space.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: related to space

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates a transition event to a movement model that describe this action.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: specified by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation between a physical space and the objects located in such space.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: contains

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a building or a building space and the spaces it can be divided into.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has space

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship indicating the address of a building
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: building address

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship indicating the value of a coefficient.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: coefficient value

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship indicating the magnitud of a control action over a building system.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: control value

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Average duration of an event.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: duration

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Earliest occurrence time of an event.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: early occur time

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship that indicates the month when a season ends.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: end season

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The end time of an event or activity.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: end time

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Identifier of an element given in the obXML file. Attribute considered for backward compatibility.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: identifier

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship that indicates the maximum number of occupants inside a space.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: max number occupants

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Upper boundary of a parameter range description.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: max range value

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship that indicates the minimum number of occupants inside a space.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: min number occupants

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Lower boundary of a parameter range description.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: min range value

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The minimal duration of an event.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: minimal duration

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Age of an occupant
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: occupant age

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Gender of an occupant
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: occupant gender

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Jobtype of an occupant
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: occupant jobtype

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Lifestyle of an occupant
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: occupant lifestyle

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates which days that act as time drivers are holidays.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: on holidays

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Percentage of occupancy time in a space.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: percent time presence

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship that links a probility to an event. For example the occurance probability of a meeting.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: probability

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Relationship that indicates the month when a season start.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: start season

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The start time of an event or activity.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: start time

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The typical duration of an event or activity.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: typical duration

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Typical occurrence time of an event.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: typical time

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Building where the occupancy behaviors occur.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Building

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent the different spaces the building have and where the occupant behaviors occur.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Space

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range of parameter values where occupants do not feel accoustic discomfort and therefore, they don't carry out any actions.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Accoustic Need

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Actions are the interactions with systems or activities that an occupant can conduct to achieve environmental comfort. Actions connect occupants' inside-world needs with the environmental outside world. (Defintion taken from obXML)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Action

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Behavior related to the interaction with buildings
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Behavior

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent the value and name of coefficients inside mathematical formulas.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Coefficient

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent constant value mathematical formulas
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Constant Value Formula

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent instances of custom probabilistic models.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Custom probability model

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Driver represents the environmental factor from the outside world that stimulate occupants in their inside world to fulfill a physical, physiological or psychological need.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Driver

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Set of drivers that could be causing a behavior at a specific time.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Driver set

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Driver related to the environmental conditions that could be causing a behavior.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Environment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class that represent a physical variable of the environment where the driver occurs. It could represent variables that impact directly on the comfort levels of the occupant.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Environmental parameter

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent electrical equipments occupants interact with but do not have influence over indoor thermal conditions. These systems contribute to the energy bugdet estimation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Equipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Driver related to events that could be causing a behavior.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Event

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Driver related to habits that could be causing a behavior.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Habit

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range of parameter values where occupants do not feel indoor air quality discomfort and therefore, they don't carry out any actions.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: IAQ Need

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Interaction class represent the interactions of occupants with systems within a space to recover their comfort.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Interaction

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Types of interactions between occupants and systems.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Interaction concept

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Formula to model the probability of interaction between ocupant and system.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Interaction Formula

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An aggregation of SKOS concepts regarding the interaction type between occupants and space systems
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Interaction scheme

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A devide used for illumination.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Lighting device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent linear mathematical formulas
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Linear Formula

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent logit mathematical formulas.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Logit Formula

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent instances of Markov chain models.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Markov chain model

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent a meeting inside a communal space.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Meeting

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Movement class is used to represent the occupant's movements inside or between spaces.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Movement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Probabilistic model to define occupant movements inside and between spaces.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Movement Model

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Needs represent the physical and non-physical requirements of the occupant's inside world that must be met in order to ensure the satisfaction of the occupant with their environment.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Need

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Non physical comfort needs (e.g. privacy, status, etc) that could influence a behavior.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Non Physical Need

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent instances of Normal probabilistic models.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Normal probability model

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Occupants or residents of a building.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Occupant

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Types of operational modes for space systems.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Operational mode concept

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An aggregation of SKOS concepts regarding the operational mode of space systems.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Operational mode scheme

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent the minimum and maximm comfort values with respect to an environmental parameter.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Parameter Range

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Physical comfort need that could influence a behavior.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Physical Need

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent quadratic mathematical formulas.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Quadratic Formula

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Type of occupant movements inside a building or space.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Random movement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Report class indicates that an occupant seeks assistance or files a complaint about their personal discomfort, but does not take direct action to satisfy their needs.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Report

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Season of the year.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Season

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Occupancy percentage of staying in a specific space category in a building.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Space occupancy

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Driver related to spatial conditions that could be causing a behavior.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Spatial

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Type of movements to represent transition events between spaces.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Status transition

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An aggregation of SKOS concepts regarding the status transition type of movements between spaces.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Status transition scheme

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: One time event involving occupancy status transition in building level.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Status transition type concept

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range of parameter values where occupants do not feel thermal discomfort and therefore, they don't carry out any actions.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Thermal Need

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A thermostat is a component which senses the temperature of a physical space and performs actions so that the space temperature is maintained near a desired setpoint. (Definition adapted from Wikipedia)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Thermostat

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Driver related to time conditions that could be causing a behavior. It also describes the time when another type of driver occur.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Time

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Relative time of day.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Time Of Day

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range of parameter values where occupants do not feel visual discomfort and therefore, they don't carry out any actions.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Visual Need

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent weibull mathematical formulas.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Weibull Formula

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A window is an opening in a wall, door, roof or vehicle that allows the passage of light, sound, and sometimes air. (Definition taken from Wikipedia)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Window

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The day of the week.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Day of week

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Person class represents people. Something is a Person if it is a person. We don't nitpic about whether they're alive, dead, real, or imaginary. (Definition taken from FOAF)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Person

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An object in the building that can be controlled by devices, such as a door or a window that can be automatically opened or closed by an actuator. (Definition taken from SAREF 1.0)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Building object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Any Object that has a proper space region. (Definition extracted from DUL ontology)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Physical object

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Shading devices are purpose built devices to protect from the sunlight, from natural light, or screening them from view. Shading devices can form part of the facade or can be mounted inside the building, they can be fixed or operable. (Definition taken from S4BLDG ontology)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Shading device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A unitary control element provides a housing for an aggregation of control or electrical distribution elements that, in combination, perform a singular (unitary) purpose. Each item in the aggregation may have its own geometric representation and location. (Definition taken from S4BLDG ontology)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Unitary control element

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task in households, common public buildings or offices. In order to accomplish this task, the device performs one or more functions. For example, a washing machine is designed to wash (task) and to accomplish this task it performs the start and stop function.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) device that provides indoor environmental comfort. A saref:HVAC is typically used to accomplish saref:Comfort.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: HVAC

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An aspect of an entity that can be observable by a sensor.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Property

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The unit of measure is a standard for measurement of a quantity, such as a Property. For example, Power is a property and Watt is a unit of power that represents a definite predetermined power: when we say 10 Watt, we actually mean 10 times the definite predetermined power called "watt". Our definition is based on the definition of unit of measure in the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). We propose here a list of some units of measure that are relevant for the purpose of the Smart Appliances ontology, but this list can be extended.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Unit of measure

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Inaction class represents the decision of an occupant to not act and remain uncomfortable within a space.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Inaction
